{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3186178,"name":"Evan Sigl","username":"Legomonster33","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legomonster33/{size}/234529_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T13:21:48.213Z","cooked":"

Hello, I have made a differential swerve drive module.

image968×621 69.8 KB

image724×727 102 KB

image754×617 81.8 KB

image988×704 60.1 KB

image660×584 58.9 KB

Features a 4*1 billet wheel with a planetary differential to drive it.

Estimated cost of about $360 per module

Onshape link:

cad.onshape.com

Onshape

Sign in to Onshape, the #1 fastest growing CAD system in the world with over 3 million users.

some of the assemblies are set up for the gears to be properly mated if you want to see how the powertrain works.

if you have any questions or feedback, feel free to comment.

,{"id":3186326,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T15:30:13.501Z","cooked":"

If you’re using one of the planets to drive the wheel, is there a torque imbalance that needs one of the motors to hold the ring still more than the other? If not, this looks like a great design.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-04-11T15:30:33.815Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":484,"readers_count":483,"score":131.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":433876,"topic_slug":"epycyclic-differential-swerve","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/epycyclic-differential-swerve/433876/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3186355,"name":"Evan Sigl","username":"Legomonster33","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/legomonster33/{size}/234529_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T15:54:44.227Z","cooked":"

the gear ratio for driving the planet is the same from both motors so there would be minimal to no torque imbalance

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-04-11T15:54:44.227Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":437,"readers_count":436,"score":107.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":433876,"topic_slug":"epycyclic-differential-swerve","display_username":"Evan Sigl","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":21715,"username":"asid61","name":"Anand Rajamani","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58279,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/epycyclic-differential-swerve/433876/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3186384,"name":"Kevin Shull","username":"kev3712","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/f04885/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T16:21:11.496Z","cooked":"

Wow, this design is really cool. My one concern would be the rounded corner of the module, which would require curved bumpers to be legal. Shouldn’t be too hard of a fix to make it square if you wanted to.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-04-11T16:21:11.496Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":389,"readers_count":388,"score":92.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":433876,"topic_slug":"epycyclic-differential-swerve","display_username":"Kevin Shull","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47126,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"wait what im an alum now?!?!"},"post_url":"/t/epycyclic-differential-swerve/433876/4","custom_user_title":"wait what im an alum now?!?!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3186403,"name":"Bodi","username":"IthcyPrince","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/dc4da7/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T16:37:00.659Z","cooked":"

I might just be missing something, but I do not see any sort of absolute encoder on this design. Although it seems like a small thing, a zero backlash (preferably on-axis) absolute encoder is a necessity for any good swerve module.

If you draw the torque diagram for the caster box, you might find that the torque used to drive the main wheel does not balance out.

thats correct theres no encoder on the module which is something i would definitely add if we are to ever build this, theres a bolt coming up from the bottom that could be extended for an encoder to go onto.

ive never drawn a torque diagram before, are there any resources you can recommend that would help with making one for the swerve module?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-04-11T16:48:42.974Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":278,"readers_count":277,"score":70.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":433876,"topic_slug":"epycyclic-differential-swerve","display_username":"Evan Sigl","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":21715,"username":"asid61","name":"Anand Rajamani","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58279,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/epycyclic-differential-swerve/433876/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3186631,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2023-04-11T19:21:52.987Z","cooked":"

Lemme get back to you this evening. The basic idea is that you should track starting at the wheel the torques operating on each shaft. Any imbalance will make the module spin, which will load the motors. I think you’re ok here because you said the gear ratios are the same.
